org.jamesframework.core.search.stopcriteria

Class MaxTimeWithoutImprovement

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.search.stopcriteria.MaxTimeWithoutImprovement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StopCriterion

    public class MaxTimeWithoutImprovement
extends Object
implements StopCriterion
    Stop criterion that limits the time without finding any improvement during a search run.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Constructor Summary

      MaxTimeWithoutImprovement(long maxTimeWithoutImprovement, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Create a stop criterion to limit the time without finding any improvement during a search run.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MaxTimeWithoutImprovement

        public MaxTimeWithoutImprovement(long maxTimeWithoutImprovement,
                                 TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Create a stop criterion to limit the time without finding any improvement during a search run. The given time should be at least 1 millisecond.
        Parameters:
        maxTimeWithoutImprovement - maximum time without improvement
        timeUnit - corresponding time unit
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if given time is smaller than 1 millisecond

    • Method Detail

      • searchShouldStop

        public boolean searchShouldStop(Search<?> search)
        Checks whether the maximum time without finding improvements has been reached for the given search.
        Specified by:
        searchShouldStop in interface StopCriterion
        Parameters:
        search - search for which the time without finding improvements has to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the given search has reached the maximum time without improvement
